abstract: The golden age of water — unlimited, cheap, safe water — is over, an author argues.
snippet: The golden age of water — unlimited, cheap, safe water — is over, an author argues.
lead_paragraph: Charles Fishman, a longtime writer for Fast Company magazine, is the author of “The Big Thirst,” a new book on water. He previously wrote “The Wal-Mart Effect,” which was an Economist “book of the year” in 2006 and a finalist in The Financial Times’s awards for best business book. Our conversation follows.

headline.main: ‘The Big Thirst': The Future of Water
